QuestData.Title: Practical Vengeance
QuestData.Description: Under ordinary circumstances I am not a vengeful man. In fact, I am somewhat of a pragmatist. You see, practicality is a paradoxical notion to vengeance. Most revenge ploys are highly impractical.$B$BBUT... in this case - since you're already going to the ruins of Dalaran - you might as well kill every Dalaran affiliated human that you see. The reasons that I want them dead range from hatred to anger to betrayal, but I assure you they are all legitimate gripes. Do this for me and I will pay you handsomely.
QuestData.CompletionText: The people of Dalaran must suffer for what they did to me!
QuestData.RewardText: I thought for sure that with the death of a dozen of my most hated enemies I would feel a great burden lifted from my shoulders. Sadly, I do not feel a thing. Perhaps I am a psychopath.
